intro: Deprea altomayoensis, commonly known as the Altomayo's deprea, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in high-altitude environments, often found in rocky soils and open mountainous areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
